title: Role of Islam in Iran and Nigeria

content.prompt: Which best explains why Islam plays a larger role in the political culture of Iran than that of Nigeria, despite Muslims making up a majority of the population in both countries?

choices.label: Unlike Nigeria's society, Iran's society is male-dominated and thus more compatible with an important political and public role for Islamic candidates.
Candidates for Nigeria's legislature must be vetted by a council of clerics before they may run for office, while the members of Iran's legislature do not face any religious tests.

Muslims in Nigeria make up the majority in only some of the states of the country, so different regions have different religious influences upon political culture, unlike Iran where Shia Muslims are a majority throughout the country.

Iran is a theocratic regime while Nigeria is a democracy, so Nigeria's government denies religious candidates the opportunity to run for office, unlike in Iran where all candidates for office are vetted by the Guardian Council.

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain the implications of the similarities and differences between countries with different political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
